item.title: Website team update on 2025-05-12 14:28:00
item.description:
ðŸ‘‹ Hello everyone! The Website Team has been hard at work these past few months, and weâ€™re thrilled to share a few of our latest improvements:

  1. Switched our package manager to pnpm (#7662) â€“ Reduced install times in our CI and development environments thanks to pnpmâ€™s disk-space optimizations. â€“ Optimized our dependencies using pnpm's strict dependency deduplication.

  2. Proposed a migration in nodejs/node to our new api-docs-tooling (https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/57343) â€“ Opened a pull request to replace the current Node.js documentation generator with our modern,api-docs-tooling. â€“ This is the first step in our documentation revamp and migration!

  3. Extracted our UI components into a standalone design-system package (#7401) â€“ We've consolidated elements, layout utilities, and more into @node-core/ui-components for easy import across the organization. â€“ This ensures a single source of truth for styles and behavior, reducing duplication and speeding up feature development.

  4. Upgraded to Tailwind CSS v4 (#7507) â€“ We are happy to see faster builds and smaller CSS bundles

  5. Support for Cloudflare Workers (#7383)

    • We also now support Cloudflare Workers!
    • This way, our deployments can be deployed anywhere, at any time.

Weâ€™re excited about these changes and the benefits theyâ€™ll bring to our developer experience, documentation quality, and overall site performance. Stay tuned for more updatesâ€”and as always, feedback is welcome!

item.title: Node-API and node-addon-api teams update on 2024-06-14 04:53:48
item.description: Today I successfully used to call native macOS APIs via Swift from the Node.js process of an Electron project. It's missing from the documentation, but it seems more recent and more comprehensive than the currently listed .node-swiftnode-api-engine-bindings.mdswift-napi-bindings

team using it to integrate with .NativeScriptconsidersReact Native

Uvwasi team update on 2023-09-17 07:54:25
item.description: v0.0.19 was released which includes an initial implementation of the WASI preview 1 socket methods including https://github.com/WebAssembly/WASI/blob/main/legacy/preview1/docs.md#-sock_acceptfd-fd-flags-fdflags---resultfd-errno. The next step is to expose these in the Node.js WASI implementation.
